reviews.text: With the Galway races going on I hesitantly booked this little B&B and was frankly concerned. I totally surprised at how nice it was. Maura was a most congenial hostess. Yes it's older as are most places in Ireland but it was neat as a pin and VERY comfortable. Breakfast was very good too. We got a very nice night's sleep there.
reviews.title: a totally nice surprise

reviews.text: There's a convenient grocery store a block away. The town is really nice too.
reviews.title: Perfect B&B!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Thanks Maura! I'd go back in a heart beat,
reviews.title: The perfect Irish B &B

reviews.text: Pat
reviews.title: Perfect place for a short visit

reviews.text: We stayed at Fallon's B&B for 3 nights. The food was perfect, our room was very cozy, and the owner and staff were very friendly! The breakfast was amazing and all the service was better then the highest expectations someone could set. We were very happy and we will be back again! Plus it is in the heart of Kinvara, a very beautiful town to walk around.
reviews.title: Lovely place and lovely host

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We recently enjhoyed a one-night stay. Our room was upstairs (okay for wi-fi connectivity) and was average in size. The shower had plenty of hot water but not much pressure. The room was comfortable and the host was very helpful with nearby suggestions for dinner and directions the next morning. Breakfast in the morning was above average with fast & friendly service. Parking was tight but adequate; we would stay again if we were looking for another night in the area.
reviews.title: Friendly B&B

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I spent 3 nights at Fallon's B&B in Kinvara in September. It was a perfect place for us. Kinvara is small, but has a few pubs ... with music and restaurants with good food. It is on the bay and Dunguiar Castle is nearby. It is an easy and beautiful drive to Doolin and the Burren. Maura Fallon and her family are welcoming and generous helping us start each day with a hearty breakfast ... freshly cooked and giving us directions and tips about places we wanted to see. One day was pretty rainy and we spent that time simply exploring the streets and a few shops. There was a quiet evening of music in Green's ... a local man named Luke and and Englishman named Alan played beautiful ballads we listened and sometimes joined in. Another evening was in Keough's with lively music and local people in the "audience" joining singing as well.
reviews.title: Fallon's and Kinvara ... little treasures!

reviews.text: Maura Fallon keeps a very clean and tidy place with comfortable beds and a cozy atmosphere and in her quiet gentle way she makes you feel at home.
reviews.title: Kind, accommodating and warm welcoming

reviews.text: We stayed there on Saturday 21/09/2013 as part of a cycling tour and had a very enjoyable time at Fallon's. The beds were super comfortable, great location right in the middle of Kinvara, breakfast was gorgeous and the staff were very friendly, would definitely recommend again.
reviews.title: Lovely family run B&B

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Maura was so kind and helpful, went out of her way to answer our questions. Very accommodating for breakfast. Kinvarra is a small village with a few pubs. Lots of charm, step back in time, and enjoy a slower pace of life.
reviews.title: Comfortable, Great Location

reviews.text: We stayed at Fallon's B&B in Kinvara in early July 2013 and had a fantastic experience. Maura Fallon, the owner/manager, was an incredible host. She went out of her way more than once to accommodate my family's needs. I traveled with my wife and 3 small children and stayed in the family room, which was spacious and comfortable. There was enough room on the floor for my two boys to play with their toys and to set up our port-a-crib for the baby. The beds were comfortable. The full Irish breakfast was delicious and freshly made. We searched a lot for B&B's before making our reservation and Fallon's was the least expensive around. We were able to park off-street in front of the B&B. It was conveniently located in the center of town and not too far away from the Burren, a beautiful part of the country. We would stay at Fallon's B&B again if we ever go back to the area.
reviews.title: Great B&B w/ great service!

reviews.text: It was a wonderful and welcoming B&B. Maura goes above and beyond making sure we are comfortable and the rooms are to our liking. Maura gave us suggestions where to have a meal and provided a wonderful breakfast. It was a wonderful way to start our vacation in Ireland. Very clean and walking distance to the castle and water.
reviews.title: Welcoming & Inviting B&B

reviews.text: We thoroughly enjoyed our visit, and I wish we could have stayed longer. We arrived after a long day of driving up from Dingle, stopping at the Cliffs of Moher, driving along the coast of the Burren and visiting the Aillwee Caves. We were a big crowd to handle together (15 in all) and Maura made us feel welcome and comfortable. The B&B was charming, and breakfast was delicious. We also unknowingly left behind a pair of headphones and Maura was kind enough to mail them home to us.
reviews.title: Charming in a great location

reviews.text: About an hour and 20 minutes from Shannon. This B&B and town are a great stop for your first night in the Emerald Isle. We made reservations for the Castle dinner, the B&B is walking distance from the castle. We had a great dinner there and stopped by the local grocery store on the way back. The rooms are very spacious, everything was very clean. The deck was great for relaxing and having a nice Tea.
reviews.title: Very nice little B&B!

reviews.text: Breakfast was excellent, nice roomy dining area.
reviews.title: Fantastic

reviews.text: We stayed 2 nights in Kinvara at Fallons and loved the town and loved Maura's hospitality as well as her family's. Bed's were very comfortable, b&b is conveniently located and they knew everything we needed to know about the area and were so helpful. My husband accidentally left his wedding ring there and they searched the whole room for it for us and set it aside in a safe place until we could drive back and pick it up. Breakfasts were great. Such a wonderful home base for us to explore the cliffs of moher and the burren. This is place is an excellent value for it's price. We would visit again. We found this b&b on tripadvisor and I had seen a few complaints about street noise, but we had no complaints about street noise and if you ask them for a room away from the street if you're very sensitive to noise I am sure they would do all they could to accomodate you.
reviews.title: Spot on. Everything we wanted in a bed and breakfast.

reviews.text: We stayed just one night on our way to Doolin to get the Ferry. The rooms were clean, the bed comfy, the shower hot, the breakfast just right, the rates reasonable. Additionally, there are pubs in town for traditional music and friendly people as well. This little harbor town is quaint and charming and Fallon's is a fine place to stay. Kathleen
reviews.title: A Comfy Stay

reviews.text: This was a delightful little bed and breakfast. Not only were the prices reasonable but the hostess was wonderful. She was so kind and helpful. The rooms were clean, roomy and beautiful. The breakfast was delicious. There was plenty of food and a great variety. The hostess continued to offer us more. I would go back again to this area just to stay in this bed and breakfast. (Ok it's closeness to the beautiful Cliffs of Moher helps.)
reviews.title: Fallon's Bed and Breakfast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed a night at this b&b. Is so centrally located in this tiny town with everything walking distance. Rooms are very well set out, comfortable and clean. Host Maura is very welcoming, friendley and helpful. Ourroom was on the main road and we were initially concerned about road noise but was very quiet and wouldnt hestitate recommending a road side room. Breakfast was very good also. The pub directly across the road was recommended by Maura and we enjoyed a meal that was just like home cooked -one of only two meals that were as good as home cooked.
reviews.title: Irish road trip

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here recently for a Saturday night. It is a standard old style B+B. We had to call to a petrol station about 50 meters away to check in. Staff were extremely helpful, couldn't do enough for us. The room was fine, little old fashioned, like going back in time. Good value and great location.
reviews.title: Standard old style B+B
